name.description: The display name of the user.

FocusSession.title: FocusSession
FocusSession.description: Represents a focus session using the Pomodoro timer.

id.description: Unique identifier for the FocusSession entity.

startTime.description: The start time of the focus session. (date-time format)

endTime.description: The end time of the focus session. (date-time format)

duration.description: The duration of the focus session in minutes.

interruptionCount.description: The number of times the user was interrupted during the focus session.

params.description: The unique identifier of the user.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure secure and scalable data management for the StudioZen application, focusing on authorization independence and clear data ownership. User-specific data (FocusSessions) is stored under path-based ownership (`/users/{userId}/...`), ensuring only the owning user can access their data. This structure avoids the need for complex security rules that require reading parent documents, thus enabling atomic operations. FocusSession entities will exist as a subcollection of user documents to ensure that the authenticated user has access to this information. This approach achieves authorization independence by leveraging the inherent path-based ownership in Firestore, which simplifies security rules and enhances performance.
